title: 115_hr1728
content: BOUNDARY MODIFICATION, MORLEY NELSON SNAKE RIVER BIRDS OF PREY NATIONAL CONSERVATION AREA, IDAHO. The curr_chunk provides definitions for key terms related to the Morley Nelson Snake River Birds of Prey National Conservation Area, including Conservation Area, Gateway West, Map, Sage-grouse species, and Secretary. It also outlines the modification of the Conservation Area boundary to include certain areas. The curr_chunk modifies the boundary of the Morley Nelson Snake River Birds of Prey National Conservation Area by adding approximately 4726 acres of BLM Administered Lands and 86 acres of BOR Administered Lands, while excluding approximately 761 acres of land. The Secretary is defined as the Secretary of the Interior. The curr_chunk excludes approximately 761 acres of land depicted as "Segment 8 Revised Proposed Route" and 1,845 acres of land depicted as "Segment 9 Revised Proposed Route" from the Morley Nelson Snake River Birds of Prey National Conservation Area. The Secretary shall issue a right-of-way to Gateway West for the construction and maintenance of transmission lines on the land excluded from the Morley Nelson Snake National Conservation Area. The right-of-way must align with the revised proposed routes for segments 8 and 9. The Secretary shall issue a right-of-way to Gateway West for the construction and maintenance of transmission lines in accordance with specified conditions, including mitigation and conservation measures. Gateway West will contribute $2,000 per acre for conservation in the Conservation Area during construction of Segment 8 and Segment 9. They will also cover costs for boundary modifications and associated expenses. Gateway West will pay all costs associated with boundary modifications, surveys, recording costs, and other reasonable costs. The Secretary will administer the lands as part of the Conservation Area and National Landscape Conservation System. Administrative jurisdiction over 86 acres of land is transferred from the Bureau of Reclamation to the Bureau of Land Management. The Secretary will transfer administrative jurisdiction over 86 acres of land from the Bureau of Reclamation to the Bureau of Land Management. A map of the lands will be available for public inspection. The Secretary must amend the management plan for the Conservation Area within 18 months to address long-term management activities and grazing of livestock on the lands. The Secretary will transfer administrative jurisdiction over 86 acres of land from the Bureau of Reclamation to the Bureau of Land Management. A map of the lands will be available for public inspection. The Secretary must amend the management plan for the Conservation Area within 18 months to address long-term management activities and grazing of livestock on the lands. Management activities include grazing, motorized access on existing roads, and hunting and fishing on the described lands. The Cotterel Wind Power Project area, approximately 203 acres of Federal land, is prohibited from being used for wind electricity production. The Secretary of the Interior will establish a Bureau of Land Management Foundation as a charitable corporation with similar authorities to the National Park Foundation. The Foundation aims to address challenges such as reclamation of legacy wells, sustainable management of wild horses, responsible development techniques, voluntary conservation activities, and identification of cultural treasures on public lands.
